name: 2fcoidinvd
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wceq(ccnv(c0), c1))
-| wi(w0, wf1o(c0, c2, c3))
-| wi(w0, wf(c1, c3, c2))
-| wi(w0, wceq(ccom(c0, c1), cres(cid, c3)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wceq(ccnv(c0), c1))
-| wi(w0, wf1o(c0, c2, c3))
-| wi(w0, wf(c1, c3, c2))
-| wi(w0, wceq(ccom(c0, c1), cres(cid, c3)))

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wf1o(c0, c2, c3))
-| wi(w0, wf(c0, c2, c3))
-| wi(w0, wf(c1, c3, c2))
-| wi(w0, wceq(ccom(c1, c0), cres(cid, c2)))
-| wi(w0, wceq(ccom(c0, c1), cres(cid, c3)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wceq(ccnv(c0), c1))
-| wi(w0, wf(c1, c3, c2))
-| wi(w0, wceq(ccom(c0, c1), cres(cid, c3)))
-| wi(w0, wf(c0, c2, c3))
-| wi(w0, wceq(ccom(c1, c0), cres(cid, c2)))

comment: Show that a function is the inverse of a function if their compositions are the identity functions. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 21-Mar-2015.) (Revised by AV, 15-Dec-2019.)
